result.execSummary:
The defendant Reuben R Salaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CORRECTED 09-24-2014:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER 1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program AFTER 1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT.
Apply 126 days credit

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $146.98 is payable to Speedway and is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  To be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Not to possess any weapons or, kives or firearms.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with any known gang member or affiliations.
No contact with the Speedway in the City of Waukesha or any witnesses.
Provide DNA sample if not provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reuben R Salaz in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Tim Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Sentencing. 
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

7 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 126 days)
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  7 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;   
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with any know gang members or affiliations
*No contact with the Speedway in the City of Waukesha or any witnesses.  
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Not to possessin any weapons, knives or firearms. 

RESTITUTION:  $146.98 to Speedway (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $278 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, after 1 year of initial confinement.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program, after 1 year of initial confinement.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing memorandum filed by Kari Larson.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
